channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024010677
item.description:
Report X-2024010677

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-29T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-13
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was traveling to load side, when it started leaking it was placed into a black tote. Then it was taken to QA for inspection. DescribePack: The bottle spilled due to a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a black tote with a bag.

item.title: Report X-2024010408
item.description:
Report X-2024010408

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: BETHLEHEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A CALL FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER RESPONDED WITH SPILL CART PPE AND RESPONSE SHEETS IN HAND. RESPONDER CLEANED UP SPILL ACCORDING TO DECISION TREE. RESPONDER TOOK LEAKING PACKAGE BACK TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.
